Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: narrow black band below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of satyr (part of head with beard in added red and right arm holding a horn remaining) to right; ivy vines as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel see Louvre Cp10421 (Beazley). For a parallel see Louvre Cp For a parallel, see Louvre Cp
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1428) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
